p: The data obtained in antioxidant assays correlate well with the contents of total polyphenols, which are known as constituents that contribute to the antioxidant activity of the plants. With regard to extracts 1E, 2E and 6E, there was no such strong link between the antioxidant activity and total polyphenol contents as there was with the aforementioned extracts. Compared to standard substances (rutin and ascorbic acid), tested hyssop preparations were less effective in DPPH radical scavenging and in the reduction of ferrous ion-2,4,6-tri(2-pyridyl)- s-triazine complex ( Table 5).
